summary.en: “In” most often means “inside/within,” used for place, time, clothing, and involvement; it can also mean “inside/at home” as an adverb, and “fashionable/included” as an adjective.
summary.zh: “in”最常表示“在……里面/之内”，用于地点、时间、穿着和参与等；作副词可指“在里面/在家（在办公室）”；作形容词可指“流行的/被列入的”。

definition.en: inside a place, container, or area; within
definition.zh: 在……里面；在……之内

examples.en: The keys are in my bag.
She lives in New York.
There is a crack in the wall.

definition.en: during a period of time; within a certain amount of time
definition.zh: 在（某段时间）期间；在……之内（时间）

examples.en: I’ll call you in the morning.
examples.zh: 我会在早上给你打电话。

examples.en: The train arrives in ten minutes.
He was born in 2005.

definition.en: wearing something (clothes, colors)
definition.zh: 穿着……；以……（颜色/风格）

examples.en: She was dressed in black.
A man in a blue jacket helped me.
examples.zh: 一个穿蓝色夹克的男人帮了我。

definition.en: involved in or part of an activity, group, or situation
definition.zh: 参与……；在……之中；属于……

examples.en: Are you in the meeting today?
He is in trouble.
She works in education.

definition.en: inside; at home or at the office (not outside)
definition.zh: 在里面；在家/在办公室（不在外面）

examples.en: Is Mr. Lee in right now?
It’s cold—let’s go in.

definition.en: fashionable or popular; accepted or included
definition.zh: 流行的；受欢迎的；被接纳/在名单中的

examples.en: That style is in this year.
Put me in for the game.

extraExplanation: “in”表示“在……里面/状态中”，而“into”强调“进入……（从外到内的动作）”。例如：She is in the room（她在房间里）；She walked into the room（她走进房间）。
常见固定搭配：in front of（在……前面）、in fact（事实上）、in time（及时）、in a hurry（匆忙）、in the end（最终）。

summary.en: “In” most commonly means “inside/within,” and it can also mean “during a time period,” “as part of,” or “using a language/way.”
summary.zh: “in”最常见表示“在……里面/之内”，也可表示“在某段时间内/期间”“在……之中/参与”“用某种语言或方式”。

definition.en: (preposition) Inside a place, area, or container; within.
definition.zh: （介词）在……里面；在……之内。

examples.en: The keys are in my bag.
She lives in New York.

definition.en: (preposition) During a period of time; within a certain amount of time.
definition.zh: （介词）在（某段时间）之内；在……期间。

examples.en: I’ll call you in an hour.
examples.zh: 我一小时后给你打电话。

examples.en: He finished the report in two days.

definition.en: (preposition) As part of; involved with; within a group, activity, or situation.
definition.zh: （介词）在……之中；作为……的一部分；参与……。

examples.en: She works in education.
There’s a problem in this plan.

definition.en: (preposition) Using a language or a particular form/way.
definition.zh: （介词）用（某种语言/形式/方式）。

examples.en: Please write it in English.
The sign is printed in red.

definition.en: (adverb) Inside; at home/indoors (often used with verbs like come/go/stay).
definition.zh: （副词）在里面；在家/在室内（常与come/go/stay等连用）。

examples.en: Come in!
It’s cold—let’s stay in.

extraExplanation: “in” vs “into”：in 表示“在……里面/处于……状态”；into 强调“进入……里面”的动作或方向。例：He is in the room.（他在房间里） vs He walked into the room.（他走进房间）
“in” vs “on/at”（地点）：in 常用于较大的空间/范围（in a city, in a country）；on 常用于表面或线上（on the table, on the street）；at 常用于具体点位（at the door, at 5th Avenue station）。

summary.en: “In” most often means “inside” (place), “during/within” (time), or “involved as part of” (a group/activity). It can also be an adverb meaning “at home/entering,” and an adjective meaning “fashionable.”
summary.zh: “in”最常表示“在……里面”（地点）、“在……期间/之内”（时间）或“参与/属于……”（团体或活动）。也可作副词表示“在家/进入”，作形容词表示“流行的”。

definition.en: inside a place or enclosed space; within.
definition.zh: 在……里面；在……内（表示地点/空间）。

examples.en: She is in the room.
Keep the milk in the fridge.

definition.en: during a period of time; within (a certain amount of time).
definition.zh: 在（某段时间）之内；在……期间（表示时间）。

examples.en: I’ll call you in the morning.
examples.zh: 我会在早上给你打电话。

examples.en: The package will arrive in three days.

definition.en: as part of; involved in; doing an activity or belonging to a group.
definition.zh: 参与……；在……之中；属于（某团体/活动）。

examples.en: He works in education.
Are you in the club?

definition.en: wearing (clothes) or shown in a certain form/medium.
definition.zh: 穿着（衣服）；用（某种形式/媒介）呈现。

examples.en: She came in a blue dress.
examples.zh: 她穿着蓝色连衣裙来了。

examples.en: Please write it in English.

definition.en: at home or at a workplace; not out.
definition.zh: 在家/在办公室（不在外面）。

examples.en: Is Mr. Lee in today?
examples.zh: 李先生今天在办公室吗？

examples.en: I’ll stay in tonight.

definition.en: arriving or entering.
definition.zh: 进入；到达。

examples.en: Come in, please.
The train is pulling in.

definition.en: fashionable; popular.
definition.zh: 流行的；时髦的。

examples.en: That style is in right now.

extraExplanation: “in”是英语里最常见的介词之一，核心感觉是“在一个范围/界限之内”。这个“范围”可以是空间（in the box）、时间（in April / in two days）、活动或领域（in business）、状态（in trouble）。
与“on / at”的常见对比：一般说 in 用于“更大/更包围的范围”（in a room, in 2026），on 常用于“表面/接触”（on the table），at 常用于“点/具体位置或时刻”（at the door, at 7 o’clock）。

summary.en: “In comparison with” means “when you compare A with B,” often highlighting differences.
summary.zh: “in comparison with”表示“与……相比”，常用于对照比较并突出差异。

definition.en: used to compare one thing with another, often to show a difference
definition.zh: 用于把一件事物与另一件事物进行对比，常用于突出差异

examples.en: In comparison with last year, sales have increased a lot.
examples.zh: 与去年相比，销售额增长了很多。

examples.en: In comparison with his brother, he is much more outgoing.
examples.zh: 和他哥哥相比，他更外向。

examples.en: This laptop is light in comparison with my old one.
examples.zh: 和我旧的那台相比，这台笔记本更轻。

extraExplanation: “in comparison with”较偏正式，常见于写作、报告或说明文中。口语里也可以用“compared with/compared to”来表达类似意思。
“in comparison with”强调把两者放在一起对照后得到的结论；如果只是简单说明不同，也常用“than”（例如：This one is cheaper than that one）。

summary.en: “In the future” means at a later time or in later times, often when talking about what will happen after now.
summary.zh: “in the future”表示“在将来/以后”，用于谈论从现在往后的时间或未来的发展。

definition.en: at a later time; from now on (used to talk about what will happen after the present time)
definition.zh: 在将来；从今以后（用于谈论现在之后会发生的事）

examples.en: In the future, I want to live near the ocean.
Please label the boxes clearly, so we can find things easily in the future.
examples.zh: 请把箱子标签写清楚，这样将来我们就能很容易找到东西。

definition.en: in later times (used when talking generally about the future of society, technology, or the world)
definition.zh: 在未来的时代（常用于泛指社会、科技或世界的发展方向）

examples.en: In the future, cars may drive themselves.
examples.zh: 未来，汽车可能会自动驾驶。

examples.en: Scientists hope to find cleaner energy sources in the future.
examples.zh: 科学家希望未来能找到更清洁的能源。

extraExplanation: “in the future”通常指不确定的未来时间点或时期；如果你想表达“从现在开始以后（每次）”，更常用“from now on”。例如：From now on, I’ll be on time（从今以后我会准时）。
写作中常见对比：in the near future（不久的将来） vs. in the distant future（遥远的将来）。
也可用更口语的替换：later on（以后）、down the road（将来某一天，较口语）。

summary.en: Inquiry means either asking for information or an official investigation.
summary.zh: Inquiry 表示“询问/查询”，也可指“（正式）调查”。

definition.en: a question or request for information; the act of asking to learn more
definition.zh: 询问；打听；查询（提出问题以获得信息的行为）

examples.en: I called the hotel with an inquiry about room prices.
examples.zh: 我打电话给酒店，询问房价。

examples.en: Please direct all customer inquiries to the front desk.
examples.zh: 请将所有顾客咨询转到前台。

examples.en: She sent an email inquiry about the course schedule.
examples.zh: 她发邮件询问课程时间表。

definition.en: an official investigation to find out the truth about something
definition.zh: 调查；审查（为查明真相而进行的正式调查）

examples.en: The government ordered an inquiry into the accident.
examples.zh: 政府下令就这起事故展开调查。

examples.en: A public inquiry was held to examine the policy.
examples.zh: 举行了公开调查以审查该政策。

extraExplanation: 你写的“In-queer-y”通常是对单词 **inquiry** 的谐音拼写。正确拼写是 **inquiry**。
英式英语中也常见拼写 **enquiry**（多用于“一般询问”）；而 **inquiry** 在美式英语里最常用，且在英式英语中更常指“正式调查”。在美国，几乎都写 **inquiry**。

summary.en: Inquiry means a formal question/request for information, or an official investigation.
summary.zh: Inquiry 指正式的询问/咨询，或官方的调查。

definition.en: a question or request for information (often formal)
definition.zh: 询问；查询（常用于正式场合）

examples.en: I’m calling to make an inquiry about your prices.
examples.zh: 我打电话是想咨询一下你们的价格。

examples.en: For further inquiries, please email customer service.
examples.zh: 如需进一步咨询，请发邮件给客服。

definition.en: an official investigation to find out the facts
definition.zh: 调查；（官方）查明事实的审查

examples.en: The government launched an inquiry into the accident.
examples.zh: 政府就这起事故展开了调查。

examples.en: A public inquiry was held to understand what went wrong.
examples.zh: 举行了公开调查，以了解哪里出了问题。

extraExplanation: “In-quiry”通常写作 inquiry（美式拼写）或 enquiry（英式拼写）。两者意思基本相同：日常/商务语境里多指“询问、咨询”；新闻与法律语境里常指“调查、听证”。
常见搭配：make an inquiry（进行咨询）、inquiry about/into（关于…的询问/对…的调查）、inquiry form（咨询表）、inquiry letter（询盘/询问信）。

summary.en: “In sight” means (1) visible, or (2) close to happening soon.
summary.zh: “in sight”表示（1）看得见；或（2）即将发生、在望。

definition.en: visible; able to be seen.
definition.zh: 在视线内；看得见的。

examples.en: Keep your bag in sight at all times.
examples.zh: 请一直把包放在视线范围内。

examples.en: The lighthouse was finally in sight.
examples.zh: 灯塔终于出现在视线里了。

definition.en: likely to happen soon; approaching and easy to imagine as the next step.
definition.zh: 即将到来；眼看就要发生。

examples.en: After months of work, the finish line is in sight.
examples.zh: 经过几个月的努力，终点已经在望了。

examples.en: With graduation in sight, she started applying for jobs.
examples.zh: 毕业在即，她开始投简历找工作。

extraExplanation: “in sight”通常不需要连字符；写作“in sight”最常见。带连字符“In-Sight”更像标题、品牌名或为了强调而写的形式。
注意不要和“insight”（洞察力）混淆：in sight = 看得见/在望；insight = 对事物本质的理解。

summary.en: An in-tray is where you put work that still needs attention, or it can mean your incoming workload.
summary.zh: in-tray 指放“待处理文件/任务”的收件盘，也可泛指你的待办工作量。

definition.en: a container or folder where papers or tasks that still need to be dealt with are placed (especially at work); also used more generally to mean the list/amount of incoming work
definition.zh: （尤指办公室的）收件盘/待办文件盘；也可泛指“待处理的来件/工作量”

examples.en: I’ll look at the invoices in my in-tray after lunch.
examples.zh: 我午饭后会查看我收件盘里的发票。

examples.en: Her in-tray is full, so she can’t take on anything new today.
examples.zh: 她的待办工作堆满了，所以今天无法接新任务。

extraExplanation: 英式英语更常写作 in-tray（对应 out-tray“发件盘/已处理文件盘”）；美式英语里更常见的说法是 in-basket 或 inbox（电子邮件语境也常用 inbox）。
在职场英语里，my in-tray is full 常带有“工作压得很满、优先级很多”的含义，不一定真的指一个实体托盘。
